intro: Gampsoceras, commonly known as the horned lettuce, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its rosette of broad, waxy, spoon-shaped leaves that are often tinged with purple. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. Gampsoceras is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in well-drained soils. It is cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
